reviews.review_msg: Now that the term is over, I would like to say Martin is the worst prof at SFU. Class average for the exam was 50% and he takes no responsibility. He does not believe that his way of writing exams is wrong, does not take student feedback, and does nothing to change. If you dont like suffering take a different prof. Thank me later.
Good luck
Definitely have to put in the work to do well. Course content basically becomes statistics in the second half of the course with lots of graphs and variables.
Midterm average was 50%.

the course was blended, but we had 3 IRL lectures. Tutorial participation is 1/4 grade but we've had 2 tutorials because of the strike and the last 3 are for presentations. The midterm was way too long for the short amount of time he gave. His slides are dry and useless. At least he seems like an approachable person.
Have to read two chapters each week like 40-60 pages

Do not take courses with Martin Andresen. He puts in no effort to teaching the class, our course alternated between online and in person lectures, but for the online weeks he just posted his lectures from 3 years ago. He makes you buy the textbook that he wrote, which has a lot of repeating points like someone trying to fill the word count. Avoid.
The most unprofessional prof at SFU. Don't trust his high review, only if you're taking an introduction class with him. DON'T TAKE UPPER DIVISION COURSES WITH MARTIN

Midterm is 6-7 pages writing (19 paragraphs) + 10 multiple choice + 10 true/false in 90 minutes. This is the first exam I've taken that I genuinely could not finish the exam because of running out of time. 
He also does not send emails out ever, even during the strike. Literally does not care.

Martin was an okay prof for this course. One aspect I didnt like was how bland and dull his lecture slides were. The entire course had to be taught straight from the textbook and nothing from the slides. My only recommendation would be that the slides need to be much better. Overall, martins course was okay, just focus on chapter questions

He is definitely one of the better profs at this school. The assignments were all clustered at the end of the term, so just be sure to plan things out ahead of time. For the exams, the written questions are right out of the chapter review questions, so study those. Overall, I would rate the difficulty as medium-high. Pretty solid elective to choose

The prof is a nice guy and you can tell he cares, my complaint is the class itself. All of the assignments are clustered around the final 2-3 weeks of class rather than being spread out in the semester. The readings are long and dry; LOTS of reading. Unless you love env crim, I do not recommend taking this class, it will be rough. Overall, avoid

Martin was great, his lectures were complementary to the textbook, if there is something in the textbook you don't understand Martin will explain extremely well in lecture. His tests are extremely fair the questions are the same from his textbook, and the same ones that are answered and discussed in tutorials, so participate and pay attention. GR8

Martin is a great guy, relaxed and funny! Class was very straight-forward. All organized and clearly laid out, easy A if you participate & do your readings! He lets class discussion steer the lecture, and really wants to help you. Material not THAT interesting, but he tries to make it better with humour! VERY easy paper and fair midterm!

This class was average. The grading is completely arbitrary and this is evident by the range/distribution of grades. Participation is mandatory yet he dominates conversations and does not facilitate student discussion. He compensates for his arbitrary grading by marking "hard" on participation. He needs to adjust his teaching styles.

Martin is a nice, approachable and funny professor. i wouldn't recommend taking crim352 because this class is all about THEORY! its a repetition of crim 300 but easier. the material is dry, although Martin tries to make it interesting. participation is a big chunk of your grade and Martin marks hard on participation. marks easier on everything else

An amazing prof. No PPT. He just sits there and talks while telling jokes nad using real life examples. It works out really well. His exams were fair since he gave us a bank of 50 questions in advance and 15 were chosen. One textbook was not used at all while the other was used for the paper or assignment.

Awesome guy, cant ask for more out of him. His lectures are different, no PP, but it causes you to listen more. His jokes are hilarious, along with his real life examples. Very knowledgeable. Recommend taking his class for Environmental Crim. One of my favorite profs at SFU for sure.

Martin is an excellent teacher! He is a very straight forward guy, and his marking is very fair. Participate in seminar and you will honestly feel that you are getting your money's worth. He is a very approachable and interesting guy.
amazing, knows his stuff. Totally fun class to attend

loved his class, he's really funny, and he goes off on tangents, but it's a good thing becuz that makes the 930am class more barrable and less likely to fall asleep. the format of the class is really great! totally recommend taking class with him :)
great class, learned a lot about environmental criminology from someone who obviously enjoys the material.

Got a C but loved his class. Got a low mark because did not study enough. Take notes! he does not post them. Exam questions were not easy. Likes to connect theorists with their theories on exams. oh and very good looking which kind of makes you want to show up for class lol
If you want to get a good grade and learn the material, then you will need to take Jordana.

Genuinely cares about her students. Gives a detailed outline, replies to emails promptly and provides a study guide for the exam. The paper topic is interesting, and she makes sure all assignments correlate to the paper, making you start it beforehand. Understanding and gives students the benefit of the doubt for missing class. Defs take again!
